description.narrative: Tonga's Third National Communication to the UNFCCC.

title.narrative: Signature Page for Tongas TNC Programme
Tonga TNC Quarterly Narrative Report – Q1/2016 – Project# 00075481

description.narrative: The project objective is to enable Tonga to prepare its Third National Communication (TNC) to the UNFCCC, an update of the Second National Communication (SNC) that was prepared during the period 2007 to 2012.
capital of a political entity

1. Chapter of TNC’s National Circumstances in accordance with guidelines as contained in decision 17/CP.8. 2. Chapter of TNC's Green House Gas Inventory (GHGI). 3. Chapter on " Programmes Containing Measures to Facilitate Adequate Adaptation to Climate Change". 4. Chapter on "Programmes Containing Measures to Mitigate Climate Change". 5. Chapter on " Other Information Considered Relevant to Achievement of the Objective of the Convention". 6. Chapter on " Constraints and Gaps and Related Financial, Technical and Capacity Needs".
[Scale = 1. Very little progress made; 2. Thematic Working Groups (TWGs) established; 3. Training workshops provided to TWGs; 4. Technical assessments conducted; 5. Chapters drafted; 6. Chapters finalized and submitted as part of TNC document]
Integrated Environmental Management of the Fanga’uta Lagoon Catchment.

title.narrative: Tonga Ridge to Reef - Integrated Environmental Management of Fangauta Lagoon Catchment

description.narrative: The IRRF is UNDP’s results framework to monitor and report on its achievements against the Strategic Plan 2014-2017. UNDP publishes country level IRRF results that UNDP’s projects contributed to
Extent to which legal frameworks are in place for conservation, sustainable use, and access and benefit sharing of natural resources, biodiversity and ecosystems
Extent to which policy frameworks are in place for conservation, sustainable use, and access and benefit sharing of natural resources, biodiversity and ecosystems
Extent to which institutional frameworks are in place for conservation, sustainable use, and access and benefit sharing of natural resources, biodiversity and ecosystems
Extent to which capacities to implement national and local plans for Integrated Water Resources Management have improved
Extent to which capacities to protect and restore the health, productivity and resilience of oceans and marine ecosystems, have improved

The Tonga Ridge to Reef project objective is to conserve the ecosystem services of the Fanga’uta Lagoon through an integrated land, water and coastal management approach thereby protecting livelihoods and food production and enhancing climate resilience.
capital of a political entity
Environment - policy, planning and administration

I) Extent on which FLC Integrated Environmental Management (IEM) Plan is completed (scale: 1. Inadequate;2. Partial; 3. Largely) II) Number of policies supporting FLC plan implementation. III) Extent on which FLC ecosystem health baselines established and monitoring of improvement (scale: 1. Inadequate;2. Partial; 3. Largely) iv) # of people (communities) benefiting from FLC ecosystem based alternative livelihood options

comment.narrative: i) completed ii) completed iii) completed iv) 100

description.narrative: 1.0 Strengthened technical capacity to support post disaster recovery planning, coordination and assessment. 2.0.Parliamentary support

1. Facilitate South-South cooperation engagement to Tonga from Fiji and Solomon Islands. 2. Support development of Disaster Recovery Framework (DRF) to guide long-term recovery and rehabilitation work.
